wiki.content: 3 A.M. was the second official single by American rapper Eminem from his album Relapse. The single was produced by Dr. Dre, along with most of the album, and was released on April 23, 2009 through Shade 45. The song was released onto the iTunes music store April 28, 2009. A music video has been shot, and has been released on May 2 at 10:00pm via Cinemax. The song deals with darker themes, pitting Eminem as a serial killer as he questions his own sanity and recalls various homicidal incidents. The song, according to Eminem, is said to be closer to the overall sound of the album, as opposed to the poppy, fun-poking "We Made You". It features Eminem presumably rapping from the perspective of his alter ego Slim Shady, utilizing both internal and multi-syllabic rhyme schemes in his three verses.[3] Eminem quotes a famous line from the movie, The Silence of the Lambs, - "She puts the lotion in the bucket, it puts the lotion on the skin, or else she gets the hose again". References to Hannah Montana and Kim Kardashian are also made. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: 3 A.M. was the second official single by American rapper Eminem from his album Relapse. A music video has been shot, and has been released on May 2 at 10:00pm via Cinemax. The song deals with darker themes, pitting Eminem as a serial killer as he questions his own sanity and recalls various homicidal incidents.
